DOC.detailed_description: Investigators hypothesize patient present significant peripheral arterial disease clinical indication treatment angioplasty , difference 12 month patency ( define PSVR < =2.4 12month follow-up visit TLR target lesion bypass ) subject Lutonix 035 Drug coat Balloon PTA Catheter IN.PACT Admiral Paclitaxel-Coated PTA Balloon Catheter . Investigators also assess compare target lesion revascularization rate , safety profile , adverse event , healthcare cost , healthcare utilization .

Patient willing able provide inform consent , willing agrees comply regular follow visit , test , medication regimen compliance another treatment deem necessary treatment vascular disease . 2 . Male nonpregnant female 3 . Age great > =18 year age 4 . Patients moderate severe claudication ischemic rest pain define Rutherford 24 class symptom 5 . > =1 tibial runoff vessel baseline 6 . Angiographic criterion > =70 % stenosis ( via visual angiographic estimate superficial femoral artery and/or popliteal artery appropriate ) 47mm vessel diameter < =15cm plan treatment segment length . Planned treatment segment proximal 1 cm bifurcation common femoral artery distal 1 cm tibioperoneal trunk . Lesions treat within target vessel either De Novo lesions previously stented restenotic segment superficial femoral artery and/or popliteal artery great 90 day prior angioplasty procedure If target vessel previously stented treated lesion must least 3 cm previously place stent Lesion must able treat either drug coat balloon device base sizes specification device Successful , uncomplicated crossing must possible within treated lesion either without cross device Inflow artery must free significant occlusive disease ( < 50 % ) confirm visual estimation angiography otherwise inflow artery must treat beforehand . At least 1 patent vessel outflow target vessel treat must present angiography 1 . Unable meet clinical criterion peripheral angioplasty followup treatment ( lab value pregnancy test ) 2 .
